name: 1-propanone, 1-(2-hydroxy-5-methylphenyl)-
Reason: 1-propanone, 1-(2-hydroxy-5-methylphenyl)- has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is propane, which has a melting point of -18.7 °C. The presence of a methyl group and a hydroxyl group can contribute to the melting point: (1) The methyl group introduces a rigid structure and increases the molecular weight, estimated at around +5 °C; (2) The hydroxyl group can participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 °C. The phenyl group also contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity, estimated at around +20 °C.
